questions.question_text: Which of the following application password cracking tool can discover all password-protected items on a computer and decrypts them?

discussion.content: D < Passware Kit Forensic is a tool that can recover passwords from over 280 file types. It is also possible to break through the encryption of a hard drive to find essential evidence.

choices.B: The system administrator has created an incremental backup
choices.C: The system has been compromised using a t0rnrootkit
choices.A: The system files have been copied by a remote attacker
choices.D: Nothing in particular as these can be operational files

questions.question_text: If you see the files Zer0.tar.gz and copy.tar.gz on a Linux system while doing an investigation, what can you conclude?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D:
It's difficult to draw a conclusion based solely on the presence of files named Zer0.tar.gz and copy.tar.gz on a Linux system. These files could contain any number of things and their contents might be benign or malicious. To determine the nature of these files and what they contain, an investigation would have to be performed to examine their contents, metadata, and any other relevant information.

Selected Answer: D
Too many clowns answering questions here. Forensics is not about being suspicious. It's about being attentive, and following the evidence. Do your research, and learn your craft.

D. Nothing in particular as these can be operational files: Correct

– .tar.gz files are common on Linux systems for legitimate purposes, such as archiving or backups. Their presence alone doesn’t imply suspicious activity.

There is no evidence that it's this: https://www.giac.org/paper/gcih/321/t0rn-rootkit/103430

Selected Answer: C
The rootkit is a type of rootkit specifically designed for Unix-like operating systems, such as Linux. It is one of the many rootkits used by attackers to gain unauthorized access and maintain control over a compromised system while hiding their presence and activities from system administrators and security tools

This question is a nightmare:

In a forensic investigation, it's crucial to be cautious and avoid making assumptions solely based on filenames. File analysis, metadata examination, and additional context are essential to make accurate conclusions and determine whether these files are benign, suspicious, or malicious.

Selected Answer: C
C. seems more logical
C. The system has been compromised using a t0rnrootkit https://pc-freak.net/tutorials/hacking_info/writeup.txt

questions.question_text: An investigator has found certain details after analysis of a mobile device. What can reveal the manufacturer information?

discussion.content: B < The ESN is a 32-bit serial number comprising 8 bits for the manufacturer code, 18 bits for a unique serial number, and the remaining 6 bits are reserved for future use.
A > Investigators should perform process monitoring as it will help them understand the processes initiated and taken over by a malware after execution.

questions.question_text: Which of the following processes is part of the dynamic malware analysis?
Investigators can use the Type Allocation Code (TAC) to find the model and origin of a mobile device. Where is TAC located in mobile devices?

discussion.content: TAC (Type Allocation Code) is an 8-digit code at the beginning of IMEI number that identifies cellular devices, including its manufacturer, model number, and regulatory approval.
A < The Type Allocation Code (TAC) is the initial eight-digit portion of the 15-digit IMEI and 16-digit IMEISV codes used to uniquely identify wireless devices.
